network.title: Network connection
network.description:
Input the IP address or hostname of the receiver and the port.

Leave the port at default 50000 unless you have configured a different port on the receiver.

data.host: Receiver IP address or hostname e.g. 192.168.1.123

advanced.title: PySerial URL handler (advanced)
advanced.description:
Provide any [URL handler as supported by PySerial](https://pyserial.readthedocs.io/en/latest/url_handlers.html).

This can come in handy when addressing USB adapters by serial with `hwgrep://` or use `rfc2217://hostname_or_ip` to connect through an rfc2217 compatible server.

error.connection_failed_network: Connection failed, check IP address and port settings and make sure this is the _only_ device using YNCA on the receiver.
error.connection_failed_advanced: Connection failed, check URL handler format.

general.title: General settings
general.description: Not all options can be autodetected. Select the soundmodes that are applicable to your receiver.

main.title: Main zone settings
main.description: Not all options can be auto detected. Select the options that are applicable for the main zone.

zone2.title: Zone 2 settings
zone2.description: Not all options can be auto detected. Select the options that are applicable for zone 2.

zone3.title: Zone 3 settings
zone3.description: Not all options can be auto detected. Select the options that are applicable for zone 3.

zone4.title: Zone 4 settings
zone4.description: Not all options can be auto detected. Select the options that are applicable for zone 4.

no_connection.title: No connection
no_connection.description:
Could not connect to the receiver.

Click 'Submit' to mark the integration for reconfiguration to be able to change the connection settings (or close this window to do nothing).

abort.marked_for_reconfiguring: Configentry is marked for reconfiguration. You might need to refresh the browser.

send_raw_ynca.name: Send raw YNCA command
send_raw_ynca.description: Send raw YNCA commands, intended for debugging. Responses can be seen in the 'history' part of the diagnostics file or in the Home Assistant logs after enabling debug logging on the Yamaha (YNCA) integration.

raw_data.name: Raw YNCA data
raw_data.description: Raw YNCA data to send. One command per line. Needs to follow YNCA format @SUBUNIT:FUNCTION=VALUE
